Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, de novo designed, man-made sequences

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (81.82%) toRV2R=V: 27%.  GRAVY: 0.12; M Wt:  2679.351; Mol formula:  C118H209N42O25S2; molar extinction coeff: 5675.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or UB1005 or K88 or K99 strains (MIC 1-2 uM), S. pullorum 7913 (MIC 1 uM),  S. enterica serovar Typhimurium C7731 or 14208 (MIC 2 uM), P. aeruginosa 27853 (MIC 2 uM), S. choleraesuis CVCC503 (MIC 1 uM), S. aureus ATCC 29213 or 29523 or MRSA 43300 (MIC 2-4 uM), S. epidermidis 12228 (MIC 2 uM), and E. faecalis 29212 (MIC 2 uM).Antimicrobial robustness:  salt-insensitive:E. coli: NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:E. coli (4.5 mM salt); NH4Cl-insensitive:E. coli (6 uM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (1 mM salt); CaCl2-insensitive:E. coli (2 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:E. coli (8 uM salt); FeCl3-insensitive:E. coli (4 uM salt); NaCl-sensitive:S. aureus (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:S. aureus (4.5 mM salt); NH4Cl-insensitive:S. aureus (6 uM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (1 mM salt); CaCl2-sensitive:S. aureus (2 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (8 uM salt); FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (4 uM salt).Toxicity: 10% hemolysis concentration > 128 uM (poor hemo.lytic).
Literature Information.Author: Wang C, Shao C, Fang Y, Wang J, Dong N, Shan A. 2021
Literature Information.Title: Binding loop of sunflower trypsin inhibitor 1 serves as a design motif for proteolysis-resistant antimicrobial peptides.
